definitions.definition: One who occupationally provides assistance by working with records , accounts , letters , etc.; an office worker .

subdefinitions.definition: A salesclerk ; a person who serves customers in a store or market.
An employee at a hotel who deals with guests.
The chief legal advisor of a legislature or legislative chamber , who is usually also responsible for keeping minutes of sittings .

definitions.definition: A facilitator of a Quaker meeting for business affairs .
In the Church of England, the layman that assists in the church service, especially in reading the responses (also called parish clerk and Bible clerk ).
A cleric or clergyman (the legal title for clergy of the Church of England is "Clerk in Holy Orders", still used in legal documents and cherished by some of their number).

main_definition: One who occupationally provides assistance by working with records , accounts , letters , etc.; an office worker .
secondary_definitions: ( Quakerism ) A facilitator of a Quaker meeting for business affairs .
( archaic ) In the Church of England, the layman that assists in the church service, especially in reading the responses (also called parish clerk and Bible clerk ).
( dated ) A cleric or clergyman (the legal title for clergy of the Church of England is "Clerk in Holy Orders", still used in legal documents and cherished by some of their number).
